intro: Hyperthelia polychaeta, commonly known as the hairy sandburs, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its branched stems and small, spiny fruits. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal and inland areas. Its leaves are narrow and sometimes hairy, while its flowers are small and inconspicuous. Hyperthelia polychaeta is adapted to arid environments and plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils.
